author: Special Correspondent
text:
Admitting that the U.S. was a “huge” beneficiary of the brain drain in India, Nobel laureate and American particle physicist David J. Gross said India will be making a “big mistake” if it discourages its people from going abroad in search of greener pastures.

Responding to queries at an interaction programme with journalists here on Monday, Prof. Gross said the only option before India was to either “close the door” to emigration or create opportunities locally for people to pursue their chosen area of research.

Though Indians abroad had very strong emotional ties with their native country, they are unable to return due to absence of opportunities.
title: ‘Don’t stop Indians from going abroad’
